entries.name: Tremont Tavern
entries.blurb: Char-grilled, loud, and zero pretense. The kind of place you go back to when you want it done right.

entries.name: Main St Meats
entries.blurb: A slicker bite with serious smoke and a menu that always feels one step ahead.

entries.name: Mean Mug
entries.blurb: Strong coffee, no fuss. The spot where locals actually work and the vibe stays chill.

entries.name: Velo Coffee
entries.blurb: Bright, clean, and always dialed in. Third-wave done right without the attitude.

entries.name: Sunset Rock
entries.blurb: The classic overlook. Short hike, big payoff, and you'll share it with half the city on a good night.

entries.name: Renaissance Park
entries.blurb: River views, open trails, and way fewer crowds. The locals' pick when Sunset feels too busy.

entries.name: Honest Pint
entries.blurb: Craft beer, zero pretense, and a patio that feels like your friend's backyard.

entries.name: Hair of the Dog
entries.blurb: Dive bar energy with a killer tap list. Late nights, loud music, good people.

entries.name: Taco Mamacita
entries.blurb: Upscale tacos with a scene. Great for groups, even better for margaritas.

entries.name: Taqueria Jalisco
entries.blurb: No frills, all flavor. The real deal for tacos, tortas, and authenticity.

entries.name: Rembrandt's
entries.blurb: Cozy, romantic, and consistently excellent. The date night standard.

entries.name: St. John's
entries.blurb: Farm-to-table done with soul. Seasonal menu, warm vibe, worth the wait.
